ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.2_0: At that time a nun who was a pupil of Bhaddā Kāpilānī attended on her with care.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.3_0: Bhaddā Kāpilānī said to the nuns,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.4_0: “Venerables, this nun is attending on me with care. I’ll give her a robe.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.5_0: Then, because of misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection, that nun complained about Bhaddā Kāpilānī,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.6_0: “Venerables, if I didn’t attend on her with care, she wouldn’t give me a robe.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.7_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.8_0: “How can a nun complain about someone else because of misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.12_0: “... How can a nun complain about someone else because of misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.14_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:1.15.1_0: ‘If a nun complains about someone else because of misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.1.7_0: Because of a lack of proper reflection:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.1.10_0: if she complains about one who is fully ordained, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.1_0: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives them as such, and she complains about them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.2_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she complains about them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.3_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive them as such, and she complains about them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.4_0: If she complains about someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.5_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.6_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.2.7_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.3.1.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.3.3_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc18:2.3.4_0: The eighth training rule is finished.
